mayaya.title: Mayaya ‚Äî From a personal idea to an essential tool
mayaya.description: AI bot capable of learning to play autonomously, providing statistics, a competition mode, and an in-game overlay
mayaya.subtitle: How a simple basic bot became the BombParty community‚Äôs favorite companion
mayaya.game_desc: BombParty is an online game where speed and vocabulary go hand in hand. Each round, a syllable appears (e.g., "tra"); players have a few seconds to type a word containing it ("travel", "contract", etc.) before the virtual bomb explodes. Easy to pick up, the real challenge lies in the pressure of the clock!

origin.title: Origin of Mayaya
origin.description: It all started with a simple observation: on BombParty, you couldn‚Äôt play solo or practice. No single-player mode, just public matches with random opponents. Frustrated by these limits (and admittedly a bit bored), I launched a little bot for fun

steps.title: A prank
steps.desc: Originally it was just a joke: a bot that replied ‚Äúfeur‚Äù whenever someone typed ‚Äúquoi‚Äù in chat

steps.title: The .exe tool
steps.desc: The bot gained traction, so I added fun features. When a friend wanted to try it, I packaged everything into a Python app with a simple GUI

steps.title: Then the 24/7 bot
steps.desc: Running the bot locally was nice‚Ä¶ but inconvenient. So I migrated to a Node.js bot hosted online around the clock, with over 30 commands and advanced training modes

steps.title: Finally, the overlay
steps.desc: The last hurdle was switching to chat to see scores and stats. So I added a visual overlay: a clean, responsive, modular interface

origin.conclusion: This journey‚Äîfrom simple prank to full overlay‚Äîinspired the BombParty devs to adopt many of these ideas natively!

python.label: Python Bot
python.objective: Provide a simple solution allowing any player to add a bot to a channel, without complex setup or technical dependencies.
features: Intuitive visual interface for managing bots and joining channels
Reads syllables via WebSocket and responds automatically using a local dictionary
Various options: autojoin, easter eggs, conversational AI replies
limits: No data persistence
Manual reconnection after crashes
Lack of error handling
Unsigned executable, blocked by some antivirus software
Heavy maintenance: manual recompilation after each change

node.label: Mayaya Bot
node.objective: Develop a centralized, continuously hosted bot capable of interacting with players, learning automatically, retaining statistics, helping new players, and offering advanced features.
features: Main channel accessible at all times
Over 30 commands available: statistics, help, moderation‚Ä¶
Competitive training mode tracking WPM, reaction time, and accuracy
Automatic learning of new words by observing ongoing games
Interactive real-time dialogue with the bot
Contextual reactions to recognized players (via GPT embed)
Automatic reconnection if disconnected
Secondary instances without impacting the main room
limits: No visual dashboard: everything managed via in-game chat
PostgreSQL database access limited to text interface

overlay.label: Overlay
overlay.objective: Display performance data in real time, accessible to all players, without relying on a bot. Designed as a complement to the game‚Äôs UX.
features: Customizable stats table (WPM, reaction time, error rate‚Ä¶)
Filterable training module (random, occurrences, regex‚Ä¶) with dynamic highlighting
Integrated practice and personal bots directly in-game
Persistence of user preferences (GM_setValue)
Keyboard-first, modular, accessible interface
Enhanced player profile
100% client-side, with no server requests
limits: Abandoned before final release: BombParty integrated main ideas natively
Highly sensitive to DOM changes
No mobile support

funFact.title: Fun Fact: The war of attrition against Maca
funFact.intro: When I launched Mayaya, Maca‚Äîthe BombParty staff‚Äôs enforcer‚Äîbecame a real blockade:

items.text: Only one bot was tolerated; all others were wiped out
Every ‚Äúfun‚Äù feature (profile GIFs, birthday alerts‚Ä¶) was removed in a hotfix
A stealth reCAPTCHA and WebSocket encryption to stifle any initiative

funFact.war_intro: Rather than giving up, we launched a real war of attrition:

warSteps.text: Bypassing the reCAPTCHA by simulating HTTP requests and user interactions
Intensive reverse-engineering of WebSocket traffic at every patch
Auto-adaptive scripts capable of keeping pace with real-time updates

funFact.conclusion: After a year-long tug-of-war against Maca (already widely despised by the community), he finally gave up. Before disappearing, he lifted all anti-bot protections (reCAPTCHA, obfuscation). A wave of innovative bots and new overlays swept in, and BombParty has never been more alive.

mayaya.remark_label: After two years of 24/7 operation, I stopped continuously hosting the bot due to lack of motivation to maintain the service. Other newer bots have emerged and taken up the torch, but the code remains available for local use.

arie.title: Arie ‚Äî Personal Multifunction Discord Bot
arie.description: Discord bot offering a wide range of features: engaging mini-games, music streaming, customizable alerts, data storage, and much more
arie.subtitle: One single bot to replace an entire army of bots on our Discord server
arie.discord_desc: Discord is a free chat platform (voice, video, and text) extremely popular with gaming communities, students, and project teams. Each space is called a server, composed of text and voice channels. Discord bots are automated accounts capable of responding to commands and enriching the user experience (games, moderation, music, etc.).

origin.title: Origin of Arie
origin.description: Within our Discord server, the proliferation of specialized bots (music, mini-games, GPT, giveaways, etc.) became unmanageable: tedious maintenance, scattered permissions, and frequent outages (e.g., music bots relying on YouTube getting blocked). So we created Arie, guided by three principles:

steps.title: Centralization
steps.desc: Gather all truly useful features into a single bot.

steps.title: Customization
steps.desc: Offer a tailor-made experience (GPT personalities, inside-joke commands, etc.).

steps.title: Reliability
steps.desc: Ensure 24/7 availability and a polished UX (slash commands + buttons).

node.label: Discord Bot
node.objective: Create and maintain a single, scalable, open-source bot that covers 100% of our daily Discord needs (games, music, AI, utilities) while remaining lightweight to deploy and easy to evolve.
features: Built-in mini-games: multiplayer Connect 4 via embeds/buttons + Minimax AI
Conversational AI: GPT-3.5/4 with interchangeable personalities and DALL¬∑E image generation
Music player: full controls, synchronized lyrics, persistent playlists, multi-platform search
Utilities: Caesar cipher, free Epic/Steam game announcements, other in-house tools
DevOps: automated Heroku deployment, 24/7 uptime ensured by UptimeRobot
limits: Audio depends on YTDL-Core (risk of future blocking)
GPT costs can skyrocket with heavy usage
Mobile interface could optimize button ergonomics on small screens

enhancements: Add other interactive mini-games such as hangman, quizzes
Integrate new commands connected to external APIs (anime, weather, news, etc.)
Develop a web interface to more easily manage playlists and bot preferences

snapscore.title: Snapscore +
snapscore.subtitle: From Tampermonkey injection to Node.js/Puppeteer automation to boost your Snapchat score
snapscore.snap_description: Snapchat is an ephemeral messaging app where each photo or video sent and opened ('snap') increases the user's score by one point, reflecting their social activity.

origin.description: It all started with a simple observation: I saw a friend with an 800,000-point Snapchat score, which seemed enormous to me, and I immediately set out to surpass that and reach one million.

steps.title: Discovering the score
steps.desc: When I saw that my friend already had 800,000 points, I realized how time-consuming Snapchat progression could be if done manually.

steps.title: The idea of automation
steps.desc: I wondered if it was possible to speed up the process: instead of sending and opening hundreds of snaps per day manually, why not automate it?

steps.title: The Tampermonkey prototype
steps.desc: I started by injecting a script into the Snapchat web version to add buttons that would open all unread snaps or send multiple snaps with a single click.

steps.title: Scaling up with Node.js
steps.desc: Once the prototype was validated and seeing my friends' enthusiasm, I decided to move to a more robust solution: controlling multiple accounts in parallel with Node.js and Puppeteer.

origin.conclusion: This journey, from the simple desire to exceed 800,000 points to setting up a multi-account Node.js infrastructure, not only helped me reach one million points faster but also gave my friends an easy way to boost their own scores.

tampermonkey.label: Tampermonkey Version
tampermonkey.objective: Add buttons to the Snapchat web interface to, with a single click, open all unread snaps at once or send multiple snaps in a row.
features: Open all unread snaps automatically in a single action
Send multiple snaps in a row to your own account or a group in a single action
limits: Limited performance by a single browser tab, slowing down each action
Fragile when the web interface changes (new CSS classes, HTML structure)
No parallelization possible (everything runs in a single context)
Camera is disabled when the tab loses focus, interrupting automation

node.label: Node.js Version
node.objective: Build a robust solution capable of controlling multiple accounts simultaneously, measuring performance in real time, and automatically restarting blocked sessions.
features: Simultaneous management of multiple accounts
Real-time monitoring of snaps and automatic restart in case of blockage
Headless automation via Chromium with injected front-end scripts
Console interface with detailed logs
limits: Approximately 7 concurrent sessions for optimal performance
Snapchat may impose a captcha or permanently ban a session, despite automatic restarts
Any update to Snapchat‚Äôs web interface requires immediate adjustment of selectors
Automation violates Snapchat‚Äôs terms of service and exposes accounts to permanent bans

items.text: Personal score of 10,000,000 reached in 6‚Äì7 days of continuous operation
Monitoring every 500 ms to detect blockages and automatically restart sessions

commercial.title: Commercial Aspect
commercial.description: When my friends saw how quickly I was increasing my score, they immediately wanted to do the same. So I decided to offer this service on Fiverr.

steps.title: Friends‚Äô requests
steps.desc: My friends saw my score rising and asked how to boost theirs.

steps.title: Creating the Fiverr offer
steps.desc: I wrote a listing 'Boost your Snapchat score by 100,000 points in 24 hours' with details, screenshots, and guarantees.

steps.title: First orders
steps.desc: 12 orders in 7 days, without paid advertising, proving real demand.

steps.title: Service suspension
steps.desc: Fiverr closed the listing after one week for violating their terms, and some client accounts were banned by Snapchat.

commercial.conclusion: This experience proved the market‚Äôs interest while highlighting the importance of complying with platform rules.
